The Emblem Trader is a mysterious merchant who runs the Bounty Hunter Shop. His store sells various cosmetic items, such as abyssal whip and dark bow recolours, and useful items such as Ancient Magicks teleport tablets.

He can skull the player should they ask him to, and limit potential Bounty Hunter targets to those below level 10 Wilderness only.

He also wanders the Revenant Caves in search of ancient artefacts. Players can give him ancient artefacts (either noted or un-noted) to receive a large amount of coins. However, he will only accept them on the current official Bounty Hunter world (either world 318 or 319, depending on the rotation) and on a Shattered Relics League world. This trader cannot open the Bounty Hunter shop, as he states that it is too dangerous to do so.

As an alternative to taking Coins or an Antique emblem into the Bounty Hunter Minigame, which is necessary to get a Target, players may use the Emblem Trader's Coffer to deposit the required amount of Coins up to a maximum of 2,000,000 coins.

Mysterious emblems[edit | edit source]

Players can purchase mysterious emblems from the Emblem Trader; there are five tiers of emblem with increasing values. Once a mysterious emblem is purchased, players can upgrade the emblem or sell it back to the Emblem Trader for the same amount of coins. Players cannot buy a tier 5 emblem; they are obtainable only by upgrading a tier 4 emblem.

The price of a mysterious emblem depends on its tier:

Emblem Buy price Sell price
Tier 1 75,000 75,000
Tier 2 150,000 150,000
Tier 3 300,000 300,000
Tier 4 600,000 600,000
Tier 5 N/A 1,200,000

Ancient artefacts[edit | edit source]

Players can bring ancient artefacts to him in the Revenant Caves in exchange for coins based on the tier of artefact:

Artefact Coins given GE Price Profit
Emblem 500,000 493,684 6,316
Totem 1,000,000 996,815 3,185
Statuette 2,000,000 1,982,978 17,022
Medallion 4,000,000 3,982,769 17,231
Effigy 8,000,000 7,973,453 26,547
Relic 16,000,000 15,993,400 6,600

Prestige rewards[edit | edit source]

Players who have achieved a certain amount of target kills can claim a hat from the shop:

ItemPrice
sold at		Target kill count
Bounty hunter hat (tier 1)Free1
Bounty hunter hat (tier 2)Free25
Bounty hunter hat (tier 3)Free100
Bounty hunter hat (tier 4)Free250
Bounty hunter hat (tier 5)Free1000
Bounty hunter hat (tier 6)Free2500

Old stock (version 1)[edit | edit source]

The old stock is only accessible if players had Bounty Hunter points prior to 17 October 2019 or have archaic emblems to exchange.

The old Bounty Hunter Store, which uses the old points system, will remain open for a couple of months after the full Bounty Hunter rework release to allow players ample time to cash in their archaic emblems and spend any remaining points.

Note: Depending on the player's rogue/target kills, the hat available for purchase differs; if a player's rogue kills are greater than their target kills, the Rogue's revenge will be available. If a player's target kills are greater than their rogue kills, the Hunter's honour will be available. Players can switch the hat's appearance by having a greater amount of kills in either rogue or target kills.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 January 2021
(update)

The Bounty Hunter Reward Shop has now closed and all existing Archaic and Antique Emblems have been removed, although you may still encounter the former on Deadman Worlds, where you will still be able to trade them as before.

12 August 2020
(update)

Non-members can now speak to the Emblem Trader in Edgeville to find out how many points they have available to spend.

30 April 2020
(update)

A Coffer option was added to deposit coins for the Bounty Hunter Minigame.

8 October 2015
(update)

The emblem trader can now be found in free-to-play worlds, although his shop will not be accesible there.

25 September 2014
(update)
  • There is now an option on the emblem trader to get a skull.
  • The Emblem Trader now always appears on top of other players.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Emblem Trader is supposedly allied with one of the Mahjarrat, as when you give him a mysterious emblem he will say "Thank you. My master to the North will be pleased."
  • He appears to be wearing olive-green coloured elder chaos druid robes and a slayer's staff.
    • After an update on 13 April 2017, he now wields an enchanted slayer staff.
